Wire ABC consists of segments AB and BC; AB in inward magnetic field, BC in outward magnetic field.
Calculate force on segment AB using cross product of length vector and magnetic field vector.
Force on a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field is given by F = I L x B.
Length vector LAB is L/2 i + L√3/2 j.
Cross product LAB x (-B k) results in L/2 B j + L√3/2 B i.
Magnitude of force on AB is ILB/2.
Calculate force on segment BC using cross product of length vector and magnetic field vector.
Length vector LBC is L/2 i - L√3/2 j.
Cross product LBC x (-B k) results in L/2 B j + L√3/2 B i.
Magnitude of force on BC is ILB/2.
Forces on AB and BC are equal in magnitude but opposite in direction, canceling each other out.
Total force on wire ABC is 0.
